description.p: The Other are intended as a catch-all racial option for players who want to play something of their own design, as well as a way for DMs to quickly create a custom race. A specific Other could be a member of a nearly extinct race, a mutant or variation of a more common race, the result of a magical experiment or a crossbreed of some kind.

setters.set: This race uses a point-buy system for racial features, which is not inherently supported by this tool.

p.i: Scientists have calculated that the chances of something so patently absurd actually existing are millions to one.
But magicians have calculated that million-to-one chances crop up nine times out of ten.

description.p: An Other may look however you want, as long as the DM allows it.
Make up your own! Some things to consider:

ul.li: Are there more like you or are you unique?
Is your origin natural or are you the result of some event?
Are you from this world and plane, or from another?

description.p: Your Other character is unique in its own way. You may share certain traits with your kin, if you have any, but for the most part you could be anything.
Ability Score Increase. Two different ability scores of your choice increase by 1.
Size. Your size is medium or small.
Speed. Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
Languages. You can speak, read and write a language of your choice. (Common is recommended for this)
Variant Nature. As an Other, you could be anything. To reflect this, you have a total of 14 points that you can use to “buy” traits from those listed below. You can't buy the same trait twice.
(12) Feat. You gain a feat.

(12) Wings. You have large wings, which grant you a flying speed of 30 ft. Your armor and clothing must be made to accommodate these. Altering a piece of gear to accommodate for wings costs 50% of its base cost. You can not fly while wearing medium or heavy armor, and you can only fly in spaces that are at least 15 ft. wide.
(10) Physical Resistance. You have resistance to a damage type of your choice from Bludgeoning, Piercing or Slashing.
(8) Natural Armor. Your AC increases by 1.
(6) Ability Score Increase. An ability score of your choice is increased by 1.
(6) Blindsight. You have blindsight with a range of 30 ft.
(6) Expertise. You gain Proficiency and Expertise in a skill.
(4) Common Elemental Resistance. You have resistance to a damage type of your choice from Fire or Poison.
(4) No Breath. You don't need to breathe.
(3) Darkvision. You have darkvision with a range of 60ft.
(3) Skill Proficiency. You are proficient in a skill of your choice.
(3) Increased Speed. Your ground movement speed increases by 5.
(3) Weapon Training. You are proficient with 2 weapons of your choice.
(3) Cantrip. You know a cantrip of your choice. Choose a mental ability score as the casting stat for it.
(3) Uncommon Elemental Resistance. You have resistance to a damage type of your choice from Cold, Lightning, Necrotic or Acid.
(2) Rare Elemental Resistance. You have resistance to a damage type of your choice from Radiant, Force, Psychic or Thunder.
(2) Wakeful Mind. You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed and magic can't put you to sleep.
(2) Natural Weapon. You have a natural melee weapon attack (Claws, Bite etc.) that deals 1d6 damage.
(2) Climb. You have a climb speed of 30 feet.
(2) Swim. You have a swim speed of 30 feet.
(2) No Bones. You can move normally through spaces as if you were one size smaller and squeeze (half speed) through spaces as if you were two sizes smaller.
(2) Powerful Build. You count as one size category larger for the purpose of carrying, lifting, pushing and dragging.
(2) Gills. You can breathe underwater.
(1) Extra Language. You can speak, read and write another language of your choice.
(1) Tool Proficiency. You are proficient with a tool of your choice.
As an Other, you could be anything. To reflect this, you have a total of 14 points that you can use to “buy” traits from those listed. You can't buy the same trait twice.

sheet.description: {{the-other:variant-nature:pts:used}}/14 points ({{the-other:variant-nature:pts:left}} left).

Your Wisdom score increases by 1.

As you can surely imagine, the point values given to the traits are not an exact science, and are mostly based on my own experiences from playing and running, as well as some attempts from other people online to rate different racial traits.

My initial goal when I made this was to be able to hand it to a player and let them build their own race, without overwhelming them or having to worry about them breaking anything. As a result the total power level of an Other is intended to be slightly below that of the PHB races, but the ability to pick exactly what you want should make up for that.

When using this instead as a quick way to homebrew a race for your setting you should feel free to give them a few more points as you see fit. (As a point of reference, building the variant human from the PHB would require 16 points).

This is also a work in progress and I’m adding to it and adjusting as it is required. So if you have a trait you would really like to see included, or feel that something is rated wildly inaccurately, leave me a note in the discussion section on DMsGuild and I’ll look into it.
Most importantly have fun!
